en.sc1: Let's take a look at the private instance and class variables for class MHCArrayList.
en.sc2: First, notice that class MHCArrayList implements the MHCList interface. This means that MHCArrayList is required to give implementations for all of the methods listed as part of the MHCList interface.
en.sc3: The first of the private instance variables is elements, the array which holds the list elements. Because elements must be allocated at some fixed size, the size of the array must be known when the list object is created.
en.sc4: An optional parameter is declared for the MHCArrayList constructor. With this parameter, the user can indicate the maximum number of elements permitted in the list. If no parameter is given, then it takes the value DEFAULT_CAPACITY, which is assumed to be a suitably defined constant value.
en.sc5: Because each list can have a differently sized array, each list must remember its maximum permitted size, or capacity. Instance variable capacity serves this purpose.
en.sc6: At any given time the list actually holds some number of elements that can be less than the maximum allowed by the array. This value is stored in size.
en.sc7: Because elements, capacity, and size, are all declared to be private, they may only be accessed by methods of Class MHCArrayList.
